title: Vinayak Damodar Savarkar
summary: Vinayak Damodar Savarkar (pronunciation , Marathi pronunciation: [ʋinaːjək saːʋəɾkəɾ]; 28 May 1883 – 26 February 1966), known among followers by the honorific prefix Veer, was an Indian politician, activist, and writer. He developed the Hindu nationalist political ideology of Hindutva while imprisoned at Ratnagiri in 1922.[2][3] He was a leading figure in the Hindu Mahasabha.[4]
